Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: most relevant gene symbolÂ for affected gene

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Ensembl stable ID of affected gene

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: relative position of amino acid in protein

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: amino acid change; only given if the variant affects the protein-coding sequence
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: amino acid change

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: the alternative codons with the variant base in upper case
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: codon change

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: contains extra information as key=value pairs separated by ";".

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: the extent to which the annotation profile for a given variant suggests that that variant is likely to be "observed" (negative values) vs "simulated" (positive values); higher values indicate that a variant is more likely to be simulated (i.e., not observed) and is therefore less likely to have deleterious effects
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: CADD raw score

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: ranked and PHRED-scaled CADD score
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: CADD phred score

Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC SAS chromosome count

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Z-score from Wilcoxon rank sum test of Alt Vs. Ref base qualities
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC BaseQRankSum

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Z-score From Wilcoxon rank sum test of Alt vs. Ref number of hard clipped bases
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC ClippingRankSum

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: approximate depth of coverage per sample and over all samples
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC Approximate Read Depth

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Phred-scaled p-value using Fisher's exact test to detect strand bias
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC Phred-scaled p-value

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: mean of all gene quality (GQ) values
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC GQ MEAN

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: standard deviation of all gene quality (GQ) values
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC GQ STDDEV

Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC Homozygous AFR

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Homozygous East Asian counts
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC Homozygous EAS

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Homozygous Finish counts
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC Homozygous FIN

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Homozygous Non-Finnish European counts
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC Homozygous NFE

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Homozygous Other counts
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC Homozygous OTH

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Homozygous South Asian counts
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC Homozygous SAS

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: inbreeding coefficient as estimated from the genotype likelihoods per-sample when compared against the Hardy-Weinberg expectation
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC Inbreeding Coefficient

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Root Mean Square (RMS) of the mapping quality of the reads supporting a variant call across all samples
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC MQ

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: count of all reads that have MAPQ = 0 across all samples. The count of reads with MAPQ0 can be used for quality control; high counts typically indicate regions where it is difficult to make confident calls
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC MQ0

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Z-score From Wilcoxon rank sum test of Alt vs. Ref read mapping qualities; The ideal result is a value close to zero, which indicates there is little to no difference. A negative value indicates that the reads supporting the alternate allele have lower mapping quality scores than those supporting the reference allele. Conversely, a positive value indicates that the reads supporting the alternate allele have higher mapping quality scores than those supporting the reference allele.
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC MQRankSum

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: number of no-called samples
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC NCC

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: VQSR negative training sites; chosen from variants with lowest LOD scores
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC NEGATIVE_TRAIN_SITE
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: GATK Documentation: Variant Quality Score Recalibration (VQSR)

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: the QUAL score normalized by allele depth (AD), or amount of available coverage, for a variant
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC QD
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: GATK Documentation: Variant Quality Score Recalibration (VQSR)

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: u-based z-approximation from the Mann-Whitney Rank Sum Test for the distance from the end of the read for reads with the alternate allele; only be applied to heterozygous calls.. If the alternate allele is only seen near the ends of reads, this is indicative of error
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC ReadPosRankSum

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: VQRS recalibrated variant quality score log odds
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC variant quality score log-odds
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: GATK Documentation: Variant Quality Score Recalibration (VQSR)

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: annotation which was the worst performing (furthest divergent) in the GATK Gaussian mixture model, likely the reason why the variant was filtered out
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC culprit

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Histogram for DP
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC DP_HIST

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Histogram for GQ
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: ExAC GQ_HIST
Kaviar Allele Frequency
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: ADSP Annotation WG File Release 2 README

Niagads::Annotation.NAME: Kaviar Allele Count
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: ADSP Annotation WG File Release 2 README

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Allele total over all datasources
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: Kavia Allele Total

Niagads::Annotation.NAME: Kaviar Data Sources Containing Allele
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: ADSP Annotation WG File Release 2 README

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: predicted change in percent-inclusion due to the variant reported, as the maximum across tissues (in percent)
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: dpsi_max_tissue
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: ADSP Annotation WG File Release 2 README

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: Â Z-score of dpsi_max_tissue relative to the distribution of dPSI that are due to common SNPs
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: dpsi_max_tissue z-score
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: ADSP Annotation WG File Release 2 README

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: computational prediction of transcription factor occupancy (ranges from 0 to 1 with 0 being no activity)
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: CATO score percentile
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: ADSP Annotation WG File Release 2 README

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: a list of transcription factor motifs potentially affected by a variant
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: CATO motifs affected
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: ADSP Annotation WG File Release 2 README

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: a list of cell types with DNAse Hypersensitivity regions potentially affected by a variant
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: CATO affected cell types
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: ADSP Annotation WG File Release 2 README

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: allele Occurence in the Scripps Wellderly Genome Resource (SWGR)
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: SWGR
Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION_SOURCE: ADSP Annotation WG File Release 2 README

Niagads::Annotation.DEFINITION: BP-range of the variant
Niagads::Annotation.NAME: Location
